alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 27 at 5:09AM AKST until March 01 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with locally higher amounts possible. North winds gusting as high as 20 to 30 mph near Cook Inlet could produce white out conditions at times. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially along the Sterling Highway corridor from Homer to Soldotna and northward to Kenai and Nikiski. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect widespread snow across the western Kenai, but the heaviest snow and highest snow totals are expected near Cook Inlet, including the Sterling Highway corridor from Anchor Point to Soldotna and northward to Kenai and Nikiski. There is uncertainty in when the snow will end, ranging anywhere from late Tuesday evening to Wednesday afternoon. This will impact the amount of snow accumulation.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
